byline.original: By FEDERICO RIOS ESCOBAR and NICHOLAS CASEY

abstract: Fighters with Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, face difficult task of reintegrating into society if referendum ratifying peace agreement passes; reintegration is crucial job for government, with experts warning failure to find tasks for former guerrillas could have dire consequences.
lead_paragraph: The country’s main rebel group, known as the FARC, made peace with the government. Photographs tell the story of fighters who must now decide how to reintegrate into society.
snippet: The country’s main rebel group, known as the FARC, made peace with the government. Photographs tell the story of fighters who must now decide how to reintegrate into society....

headline.main: Colombia’s 52-Year War Is Ending. Now Comes the Hard Part.
headline.print_headline: Colombia’s 52-Year War Is Ending. Now Comes the Hard Part.
